page.title: 07Gt.Yeldham Go kart Club
page.content: In 1981 a man called Mr.Doug Chapman noticed a concrete piece of waste ground behind the Gt.Yeldham football pitch and thought it could be used as a kart track. He had once raced go karts so he wrote to the Council and they agreed to his suggestion.He put up notices proposing the formation of a club with an annual subscription of Â£10 to cover insurance.More people soon joined and the racing became more enjoyable although there have been complaints from local people about the noise.Adult members race 100cc karts but children's karts are limited to 50 cc engines .The karts are only about 2cms from the ground and they can reach speeds of up to 60m.p.h. The annual membership fee is now Â£20 per family.
